title: How important is it to cover the India year book for the UPSC prelims? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: NOT NECESSARY, BUT IMPORTANT Government of India publishes Year Book every year for letting the citizens aware about the working and schemes of different departments in the government. Relevance for civil service exams: It is extremely important for a civil service aspirant to know functioning of different departments and their schemes. Lot of questions do come in Prelims and helps in writing good answers for mains. But, Year book is very bulky and takes lot of time to read and grasp. Decision: Take a call, if you are doing good revisions, improving the score in mock tests, done with reading important chapters in economic survey and making notes then go for reading important chapters in year book. However, you might replace it with Vision IAS booklet on government schemes in the month of may.
